abstract: The European Commission’s newest charges add more time to the clock, a disadvantage in the ever-shifting tech market.
snippet: The European Commission’s newest charges add more time to the clock, a disadvantage in the ever-shifting tech market.
lead_paragraph: The European Commission has hit Google with a third antitrust charge. This time it says the tech company abused its search dominance on third-party websites. It also reinforced a claim, first made in 2010, that Google favored its own shopping service.

headline.main: Google’s Antitrust Charges in Europe Need Quick Action
